Who:   P6 students
Date:   31 May – 3 Jun 2021 (Mon – Fri)
Time:   2.00 pm – 5.00 pm
Venue:   All Hua locations

 

Did you know that acing the PSLE Chinese Oral Exam can improve your child’s score by up to 2 bands? Join our 5-day June Holiday PSLE Oral Exam Bootcamp to learn exam techniques to excel in this important aspect of the PSLE Chinese Exam (Chinese Oral contributes to 25% of the total score).

Not to worry, we believe that as long as you put in your best effort to prepare for the exam, you will be rewarded with the score you deserve! Huá’s PSLE Oral Exam Bootcamp aims to get PSLE warriors acquainted with commonly tested conversational topics and train them to answer questions the examiner may ask regarding these topics. We will also share exam-taking strategies that will help your child maximise their Oral Exam score.

All performances have full-dressed rehearsals to build confidence in the performers. The PSLE Oral Exam is no different! To boost your confidence when taking the exam, we will be simulating a mock exam for you to experience and practice taking the PSLE Oral Exam.

Here’s the breakdown of what we will go through each day for the PSLE Oral Bootcamp:

Day 1 – Answering techniques for 6 question types

– Discussion for commonly tested topics
Day 2 –  Mock Exam #1 with post-mortem

–  Students to complete a composition while waiting for their turn for the mock exam
Day 3 –  Discussion for commonly tested topics

–  Listening comprehension mock exam
Day 4 –  Mock Exam #2 with post-mortem

–  Students to complete a composition while waiting for their turn for the mock exam
Day 5 –  Discussion for commonly tested topics

–  Exam Techniques & Common Mistakes Summary

Past students of this bootcamp tell us that it helped them greatly in their PSLE Oral Exam preparations. Some of them even spread the word to their classmates, who then asked if we could run another instalment of the bootcamp. Alas, we will only be running this bootcamp during the June holidays! So don’t miss out on this – sign up now to secure your spot!

Reach out to our friendly reception team to find out more, or explore this link for more details about this programme.

Spaces are limited, and we’d love to help your child secure his/her place in this popular class. You can also pass us your details through this form, and we’ll get in touch as soon as possible.

About Hua Language Centre

Established in 1992, Hua Language Centre is Singapore’s Leading Chinese Enrichment and Tuition Centre.

We offer a wide range of Chinese programmes and classes that cater to your child’s various Mandarin needs. For close to 30 years, Hua Language centre has developed and refined our own unique curriculum – we make the learning of Chinese fun and effective at the same time, through an understanding of brain science, child psychology, Chinese linguistics and exam-taking strategies.

Our Curriculum Director’s passion for Chinese and desire to help children master this increasingly useful language has driven Hua Language Centre to perfect our craft as your child’s partner in his or her Mandarin Language journey.

Who:   5 year old – 11 year old children
Date:   7-11 Jun &/or 14-18 Jun 2021
Time:   9am – 5pm daily (Mon – Fri)
Venue:   All Hua locations

 

《猫头鹰神探历险记》- Chinese Immersion Camp

Ready for solving some mysteries this June holiday? Hua’s popular 2-week Chinese Immersion Camp is back!

Help Detective Owl in its quest to attain clues by completing challenges and craft activities! We guarantee you that it will be a high-energy, fun-filled time while being immersed in a fully Mandarin-speaking environment.

In the morning, we will be splitting children into their respective levels for Chinese Head Start classes that will prepare them for next term’s school work.

After lunch, the Chinese Immersion Camp continues with children reading a chapter about Detective Owl, and completing activities to unlock the next part of the story. Besides doing hands-on activities and improving their general knowledge, children will also learn new Chinese words and practice speaking new Mandarin phrases every day through games and quizzes.

Reach out to our friendly reception team to find out more, or explore this link for more details about this programme.

Spaces are limited, and we’d love to help your child secure his/her place in this popular class. You can also pass us your details through this form (click link), and we’ll get in touch as soon as possible.

Experience Hua’s Mandarin camp magic – Fastest fingers first!

Who:  K2 & P1 children
Date:   7-10 Jun OR 14-17 Jun 2021 (Mon – Thu)
Time:  1.30 pm – 4.30 pm (timing may vary slightly across branches; please call to confirm)
Venue:   All Hua locations (United Square, Causeway Point, Greenwich V, Parkway Parade)

 

In this Hanyu Pinyin Master Class, students will use our tried and tested technique to visualise and master the abstract topic of Hanyu Pinyin, which is a key foundational piece of Mandarin studies, introduced at the lower Primary level. This programme is suitable for Kindergarten 2 & Primary 1 students.

Hanyu Pinyin is an abstract topic that can be challenging for children. Fret not – our dedicated teachers and multi-decade experience will make learning Hanyu Pinyin a breeze for your child! Countless parents who have sent their children for this 4-day master class tell us so!

Students will be able to revise the A-Z of Hanyu Pinyin and strengthen their grasp of sounds that most English-speaking children struggle with. It is also a good learn-ahead for Kindergarten 2 children who are looking to challenge themselves.

Time:   9.30 am – 11.30am (N1 – P5); 1.30 pm – 3.30 pm (P6)
Venue:   All Hua locations

 

《高人一等》- Speak Mandarin Daily!

Being exposed to Mandarin every day can work wonders for your child! Make use of the June holidays to send your child to Huá to Speak Mandarin each day, and learn ahead for the next school term. We have classes suitable for kids of all ages, starting from Nursery 1 up to Primary 6.

Parents who have sent their children for this programme attest to how effective showing up regulary each day to Speak Mandarin gives their children a level of confidence that they’ve never had previously. It also helps them to consolidate and reinforce the new vocabulary learnt during the school term.

Fret not, this will not feel like tuition. We promise that the lessons will be delivered in an interesting fashion such that learning occurs by osmosis!
